metadata.synopsis: Gyldro Angleiron the Smith, a crusty human male, runs his smithy in the center of Rivington called Angleiron Smithy.He usually greets potential customers in front of his smithy. But today, Orin the Red, perverse and malicious, has assumed his likeness and identity to greet the unsuspecting players.This is her way of learning about the players in person, to tailor-made a death just for them.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1) Use the bookmark BGO_Rivington_AngleIronSmithy2) Talk to the Gyldro Angleiron the Smith

70.text: Welcome, adventurer! I take it you're new to Rivington.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

64.text: No doubt you came here to choose from my fine selection of weapons?
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

38.text: Yes, I seem to have it all. Clubs, swords, maces, bows. Cutting and gutting galore.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

45.text: Why don't we see if we can find the perfect weapon for you?
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: How will you know my perfect weapon?
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

53.text: I provide a personalised service for my customers. To make sure the weapon I choose is the perfect fit.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: So long as it comes with a very generous discount.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

59.text: My weapons are a bargain at any price.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: All right. Show me what you have.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

61.text: Wonderful. But, patience is a virtue.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: No thanks. I've got everything I need.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

72.text: I'm not sure. Something is missing. A hole that only a blade can fill, perhaps.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

30.text: Let's get to know each other a little better. Perhaps I can make you a customer yet.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

76.text: Tell me, how do you like to kill?
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Slowly and painfully. I like to see the fear in their eyes.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

97.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
97.text: Seems you've been paying more attention to my techniques than I realised. I am flattered.

83.text: Fear is the best part, isn't it? To see them realise their life is over, its final moments nothing but agony.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Quickly and efficiently. I don't want anyone to suffer.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

85.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
85.text: You make killing sound quite dull. Where's the passion?
85.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

21.text: Come - we're all friends here. No need to pretend you don't like to twist the knife.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

19.text: And when you kill someone, what do you feel?
19.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

47.speaker: Player
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

5.text: Good answer. To kill is the closest thing to knowing the power of the gods themselves.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

29.text: One more question, if you'll humour me.
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

20.text: Do you think you could turn your weapon on those closest to you?
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

91.speaker: Player
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

100.text: This weapon must be fit for every kill. Even the ones you never think will come.

32.text: So, answer me honestly. Could you kill one you loved?

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Perhaps. If there was no other option.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

10.text: There's a killer inside you, isn't there? It wouldn't take much to push you over the edge.
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

13.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The smith's body jerks and convulses as he transforms into Orin the Red. She smirks. Long transform.

57.text: Look at it, come crawling home, hands stained with the Bone Lord's soot. And you carry his stone.
57.context: NodeContext: 'It' is the Dark Urge player. 'Home' at this point is just the city, not yet the temple. 'Bone Lord's soot' refers to the player having killed Ketheric (his god Myrkul is the Lord of Bones)

68.text: I've been watching. Waiting. Seeing how you lead your lambs skip-skipping to the slaughter.
68.context: NodeContext: Toying with the player, thinks they're wasting time indulging their companions. Player previously said they could kill a friend.

41.text: Weak and soft and broken. Oh, sweet sibling, the world has dulled you. Or maybe I poked your mind matter too sharply.
41.context: NodeContext: Mocking - the player said they would never kill a friend, which Orin finds pathetic. Allusion to the fact she put the tadpole in their skull.

43.text: I could end it now - but I'll be patient. Father will see us together again. He will see you bleed.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Toying with the player, trying to make them uneasy, establish her power over them. 'Father' is Bhaal.

80.text: So you're the lickspittle who crushed the Bone Lord's thrall.
80.context: NodeContext: First time Orin meets player. 'Bone Lord's thrall' is Ketheric, who player previously killed. Curious.

74.text: Have you come beg-begging, sniffing for our stones? Gortash won't like that. A throat his black hand can't choke the spit from.
74.context: NodeContext: Mocking, finds your plan ridiculous but enjoys the chaos it will cause. 'Stones' are the netherstones. 'Black hand' reference to the 'Black Hand of Bane', Gortash's god.

65.text: You could kill him. Let him close and make him feel the tickle of your blade between his ribs.
65.context: NodeContext: Player previously said they would kill friend. Orin encouraging this thought - playful.

25.text: When you find the lordling, tell him Orin is watching.
25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Playful, menacing. Trying to make player uneasy - she could be hiding anywhere.

77.text: He'll find your weaknesses. Stick a knife in the cracks and prise you apart. Unless you get him first.
77.context: NodeContext: Player previously said they wouldn't kill friend. Orin thinks them pathetic, but is amused at the thought of you trying to take on Gortash.

11.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.

9.text: I see how you slip-slither closer, belly dragging in the filth. Father is laughing at you.
9.context: NodeContext: Second time Orin appeared to toy with you. She can't believe you're wasting so much time.

35.text: Do not worry, slaughter kin. My blades are still sharp and sweet. They will greet you soon enough.
35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: Mocking reassurance - trying to make the player uneasy.

96.text: Still rolling in the muck, I see.

27.text: Gortash knows you are coming. Knows you have the Bone Lord's stone. Do not let him hiss hot air into your worm-weakened brain.
27.context: NodeContext: Acting like she's helping you, but just trying to freak you out. 'Bone Lord's stone' is Ketheric's netherstone

79.text: Remember - his throat spits lies, but my blade carves the truth. You will read it on your skin soon enough.
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin twists her ring and disappears.NodeContext: toying with the player, knows the 'truth' about them and is enjoying holding this against them

99.speaker: Player
99.text: I would never kill someone I cared about.
99.context: NodeContext: With a smile, ominous - picturing the horrors she'll inflict on you

3.context: NodeContext: With a smile, ominous - picturing the horrors she'll inflict on you

95.context: NodeContext: With a smile, ominous - picturing the horrors she'll inflict on you

67.text: You'll do so much worse, by the time I'm done with you.
67.context: NodeContext: With a smile, ominous - picturing the horrors she'll inflict on you

58.text: You deny yourself, but it won't last. It's in your blood.
58.context: NodeContext: Menacing/amused by your refusal. Thinks you're weak for resisting your nature.

71.text: Marvellous. You treat your friends as a butcher leading cattle to the slaughter.

48.text: You had Father's offer. His glory was in reach, and you cowered like a babe.

75.text: Alliances change and change and change again. Friend today, dead tomorrow.

22.text: I know what you do to your allies - smiling as the blade slips between the bones, lip-licking as the insides tumble out.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Bold of you to assume anyone is that close to me.

66.text: So you string your mewlings along with falsehoods. Such sweet, bloody betrayal you offer them.

102.text: Then you know how beautiful betrayal tastes on the tongue. Delicious.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: I do all I can to keep my loved ones safe from my blade.

56.text: You can't stop yourself any more than stop your blood pumping. You delay the inevitable.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: A deep sadness. I take no enjoyment in it.

49.text: You deny yourself the sweetest pleasures. But that can change, given the right circumstances.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: Relieved, usually. It's kill or be killed, and I intend to survive.

28.text: I can see it in your eyes, though - you can't help feeling a tingle of pleasure all the same.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Exhilarated beyond compare. It is my purpose.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Sated, as if my parched throat has been fully quenched.

46.text: It is a pleasure, isn't it? Warm and sweet and sticky.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I feel nothing. It's like I'm not even present.

98.text: Really? That detachment must be so liberating. Who knows what you're capable of?

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Bold. Brave, even - if the kill is just.

82.text: You take comfort in knowing your foes deserve their fate? It must be wonderful, indulging in such righteous slaughter.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Certainty. If I kill, it is because my god demanded it.

92.text: Killing holds no fear for you, does it? You understand what it takes, and what it gives.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Why do you need to know this?

37.text: Call it professional curiosity. Now tell me - how does killing make you feel?

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I've had enough. I'll buy my weapons elsewhere.

1.text: Oh you're no fun at all, are you?

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Depends who I'm killing, and how much they've pissed me off.

54.text: Oh, good answer. Killing is so much more satisfying when you really mean it.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: It flows through me as raw inspiration, I never know what my next kill will look like.

26.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
26.text: That is why you make for such delightful company.

62.text: Such imagery. You are an artist with a weapon in your hand, I can tell.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: With maximum carnage. Killing is a duty. But spilling blood is a thrill.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I wield my faith as my god demands. Without hesitation or doubt.

24.text: I see. Playing to your strengths. Keeping things simple.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I don't see what this has to do with me buying a weapon from you.

89.text: Oh, it's all part of the service. Everybody answers.

18.text: Go on. Tell me how you kill.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I'm not buying anything. Now back off.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I'm not buying anything. Now back off.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I'm not buying anything. Now back off.
